title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: When using Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only), the scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example are enabled and can be moved around, but they do not have any effect. This can be confusing, especially when opening a small image such as an icon, as the scrollbars are misleading since they do not perform any action.
OB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example are enabled and can be moved around, but they do not have any effect. This is observed when using Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only).
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled, or they should have a functional purpose when interacting with the image.
SR:
1. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
2. Observe the scrollbars and notice that they can be moved around, but they do not have any effect.
3. Open a small image, such as an icon, and observe that the scrollbars are misleading since they do not perform any action.
